item.title: The Indy Football Podcast: Is the title race over already and how will David Moyes do at West Ham?
item.description: Join host Ed Malyon, Miguel Delaney and Jack Pitt-Brooke as they dissect the weekend's action and forecast what is to come for Moyes at West Ham
item.author: Sports Staff
item.dc:creator: Sports Staff

item.title: Mohamed Salah is the signing of the season, but one improvement could make Liverpool challengers again
item.description: Even though the Egyptian is not as wasteful as many think, a slight improvement would make Liverpool so much better
item.author: Mark Critchley
item.dc:creator: Mark Critchley
item.media:text: Mohamed Salah has made an excellent start to life at Liverpool (Picture: Getty)

item.title: The decision to hire Sam Allardyce tells Everton fans all they need to know about Farhad Moshiri
item.description: Not much is known about the majority shareholder other than what is released by the club
item.author: Simon Hughes
item.dc:creator: Simon Hughes
item.media:text: Moshiri was present for the win over Watford with chairman Bill Kenwright (Picture: Getty)

item.title: Tactically inept and without a plan, West Ham should have sacked Slaven Bilic long ago - now David Moyes is their prize
item.description: The last game of the Bilic era was desperately typical and showed exactly why he had to go - no plan, no organisation, no intelligence and no real fight
item.author: Jack Pitt-Brooke
item.dc:creator: Jack Pitt-Brooke

item.title: England delighted after 'Battle of Bristol' training session against Wales that includes something of a surprise
item.description: The sight of Chris Robshaw packing down at No 8 has fuelled rumours that the England head coach could change up his back-row to face Argentina
item.author: Jack de Menezes
item.dc:creator: Jack de Menezes
item.media:text: England scrum coach Neil Hatley was pleased with the work against the Wales pack in training (Picture: Getty)

item.title: Aside from sexism and crassness, NextGen ATP finals offer glimpse of the future of tennis and evolution of its rules
item.description: The eight best under-21-year-olds on the planet battle it out in Milan
item.author: Paul Newman
item.dc:creator: Paul Newman
item.media:text: The top eight under-21s on the planet will take part (Picture: Getty)

item.title: Chelsea technical director Michael Emenalo steps down with Monaco keen
item.description: Emenalo has been a key cog in the Chelsea machine under Roman Abramovich but has seen his role increasingly under pressure in an internal power struggle
item.author: Ed Malyon
item.dc:creator: Ed Malyon

item.title: David Moyes to take over at West Ham United until the end of the season following Slaven Bilic sacking
item.description: Bilic was sacked on Monday in the wake of the 4-1 defeat to Liverpool
item.author: Miguel Delaney
item.dc:creator: Miguel Delaney

item.title: Lando Norris replaces Jenson Button as McLaren reserve driver with GP3 or F2 move on the horizon
item.description: European Formula 3 champion will attend all Grand Prix weekends in 2018 with a drive in one of the two feeder series' close to completion
item.author: Jack de Menezes
item.dc:creator: Jack de Menezes
item.media:text: Lando Norris will step up as McLaren's reserve driver in 2018 (Picture: Getty)

item.title: ATP draw ceremony branded 'disgrace' after players were made to choose female models to reveal opponents
item.description: The draw was held in Milan to determine groups for NextGen ATP finals
item.author: Sports Staff
item.dc:creator: Sports Staff
item.media:text: Players selected a model who carried either the letter A or B corresponding to their group (Picture: Getty)

item.title: Ruben Loftus-Cheek happy he left Chelsea for Crystal Palace as increased game time continues to pay off
item.description: The 21-year-old has excelled for the Eagles despite their struggles since arriving from the Blues on loan
item.author: Sports Staff
item.dc:creator: Sports Staff

item.title: Slaven Bilic 'expected' to be sacked after West Ham defeat by Liverpool, but leaves a proud man
item.description: Saturday's 4-1 defeat proved enough to end Bilic's reign at West Ham
item.author: Jack de Menezes
item.dc:creator: Jack de Menezes
item.media:text: Slaven Bilic remains 'proud' of his work at West Ham after being sacked on Monday morning (Picture: Getty)

item.title: The tragic tale of Johnny Owen and how it left a scar over Mexican boxing
item.description: Owen was Welsh, British, Commonwealth and European champion when he travelled to Los Angeles to try to add the world title
item.author: Steve Bunce
item.dc:creator: Steve Bunce

item.title: Why your Premier League club's season could be decided in the next 11 games
item.description: An unprecedented fixture pile-up is around the corner. Will your club be able to cope?
item.author: Mark Critchley
item.dc:creator: Mark Critchley
item.media:text: Manchester City are currently eight points clear at the top of the table (Picture: Getty)

item.title: David Luiz to return to Chelsea training on Wednesday after being left out against Manchester United
item.description: Luiz was axed for Chelsea's 1-0 Premier League win over Manchester United on Sunday
item.author: Matt McGeehan
item.dc:creator: Matt McGeehan
item.media:text: David Luiz was left out of the Chelsea squad that beat Manchester United (Picture: REX)

item.title: Tottenham's Harry Kane reveals plans to manage injury niggle ahead of England duty
item.description: Kane is being assessed before it's decided how much he can be involved in England's friendlies with Germany and Brazil this week

item.dc:creator: Jack Pitt-Brooke

item.title: Romelu Lukaku urged to be more selfish by Alan Shearer after Manchester United striker's seven-game goal drought
item.description: The United striker has seen his bright start fade but former England international Shearer believes he can rekindle his form by prioritising goal-scoring

item.dc:creator: Jack de Menezes
item.media:text: Romelu Lukaku has gone seven matches without a goal after scoring 12 in 11 (Picture: Getty)

item.title: Crystal Palace appear doomed to be a side that cannot win a game unless Wilfried Zaha wins it for them
item.description: It is difficult to imagine survival for a club that relies so much on one young man, however talented that young man may be

item.title: Chelsea's performance against Manchester United showed they are still behind Antonio Conte, says Gary Neville

item.media:text: Antonio Conte celebrates Chelsea's 1-0 victory over Manchester United with Cesar Azpilicueta (Picture: Getty)

item.title: Slaven Bilic sacked by West Ham as club get ready to approach David Moyes as new manager

item.media:text: Slaven Bilic has been sacked by West Ham United (Picture: Getty)

item.title: Andy Carroll takes aim at West Ham fans and believes they should be more like Crystal Palace supporters

item.title: Gary Neville believes the absence of two key players was the reason Manchester United were 'ambushed' at Chelsea

item.media:text: Gary Neville labelled Arsenal fans 'embarrassing' for their treatment of Arsene Wenger (Picture: Getty)

item.title: Rumours of Chelsea's demise have been greatly exaggerated, Manchester United left exposed, Arsenal left to rue decision
item.description: Seven things we learned: Manchester City discover their quiet hero, Liverpool need top-four consistency, Bilic pays the price for downfall and too little, too late from David Unsworth

item.dc:creator: Jack de Menezes
item.media:text: Antonio Conte took a risk in dropping David Luiz and was rewarded with a 1-0 victory over Manchester United (Picture: Getty)

item.title: Matt Jansen's Chorley not just making up the numbers in FA Cup first round tie with Fleetwood

item.media:text: Matt Jansen has overseen steady, sustainable progress at Victory Park (Picture: Chorley FC)

item.dc:creator: Sports Staff

item.title: England's Jermaine McGillvary facing 12-week ban after being charged with biting
item.description: The Huddersfield player is facing a charge of contrary conduct following the allegation brought by Lebanon captain Robbie Farah during Saturday's World Cup game in Sydney

item.dc:creator: Ian Laybourn

item.title: Chelsea showed what they are made of against Manchester United says Cesc Fabregas
item.description: Fabregas was man of the match as Chelsea claimed a 1-0 victory over United at Stamford Bridge
item.author: Sports Staff
item.dc:creator: Sports Staff

item.title: Antonio Conte refuses to shake Jose Mourinho's hand as 'it's not important' after Chelsea vs Manchester United
item.description: The Chelsea manager celebrated with his players rather than shake his United counterpart's hand following the 1-0 home victory at Stamford Bridge
item.author: Jack de Menezes
item.dc:creator: Jack de Menezes
item.media:text: Antonio Conte decided not to shake hands with Manchester United rival Jose Mourinho (Picture: Getty)

item.title: Newcastle players turned on each other after Bournemouth defeat, reveals furious Rafa Benitez
item.description: The Spaniard was furious with his team and the match officials after losing to Bournemouth 1-0, a game which saw Newcastle perhaps the most ragged they have been under his tutelage
item.author: Martin Hardy
item.dc:creator: Martin Hardy
item.media:text: Benitez was furious with a disallowed goal as Newcastle lost to Bournemouth (Picture: Getty)

item.title: Arsenal's defeat by Manchester City an example of how Arsene Wenger allowed his side to slip into a state of mediocrity
item.description: The same players who have failed to adapt over the last three years are now being asked to drag Arsenal out of the mire
item.author: Jonathan Liew
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Liew
item.media:text: Arsene Wenger has not shown an ability to adapt his Arsenal team when it's been needed (Picture: Getty)

item.title: Antonio Conte insists his decision to drop David Luiz from Chelsea's matchday squad was 'tactical'
item.description: There had been speculation that the Brazilian had been punished for his reaction to getting subbed off during the loss to Roma but Conte has denied that to be the case
item.author: Miguel Delaney
item.dc:creator: Miguel Delaney
item.media:text: Conte was keen to praise the contributions of Christensen (Picture: Getty)

item.title: Elliot Daly recalled by England after recovering from injury ahead of Argentina Test
item.description: Daly is part of 33-man squad that will gather this week ahead of the first autumn international, with the forwards set to train against Wales in Bristol on Monday

item.dc:creator: Jack de Menezes
item.media:text: Elliot Daly has returned to England training after recovering from injury (Picture: Getty)

item.title: David Unsworth delighted as Everton show 'heart, desire and commitment' to fight back against Watford
item.description: Everton have heaved themselves out of the relegation zone despite being 2-0 down to Watford with 25 minutes to go

item.media:text: Unsworth was delighted with Everton's comeback win (Picture: Getty)

item.title: Jose Mourinho insists there is still 'hope' in the Premier League title race despite Manchester United's loss to Chelsea

item.dc:creator: Miguel Delaney
item.media:text: Manchester United fell to a 1-0 defeat against Chelsea on Sunday (Picture: Getty)

item.title: Harlequins complete sensational comeback to snatch Anglo-Welsh Cup victory at Saracens
item.description: Saracens 29 Harlequins 30: James Lang's nerveless conversion deep into injury time completed a sensational comeback for Harlequins
item.author: Sports Staff

item.media:text: Harlequins fought back to stun Saracens (Picture: Getty)

item.title: Everton earn their first win in five matches as Watford throw away two-goal lead before missing late penalty
item.description: Everton 3 Watford 2: David Unsworth won for the first time in charge of Everton as his side fought back from two-goals down before former Toffee Tom Cleverly fluffed his lines at the death
item.author: Simon Hughes
item.dc:creator: Simon Hughes
item.media:text: Baines won Everton all three points with a late penalty kick (Picture: Getty)

item.title: Manchester United pay the price for going on the attack, Chelsea rely on moment of magic from Alvaro Morata

item.title: Alvaro Morata flourishes where Romelu Lukaku falters in Chelsea vs Manchester United story that was nearly so different
item.description: Both strikers on display at Stamford Bridge could easily have been wearing the other shirt, but there is only one of them who now looks like fuelling a future title charge

item.title: Alvaro Morata seals win to reinvigorate Antonio Conte's Chelsea reign yet could end Manchester United's title chances
